pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Proves existences of $a, b \not \in \mathbb{Q}$ with $a^b \in \mathbb{Q}$. See the [zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Existence.20of.20irrational.20.5E.20irrational.20becomes.20rational/near/488140274) about a discussion on the topic.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [68bcde29b1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19931/commits/68bcde29b1b61e862925f55391d179ab574001ed)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ not_irrational_rpow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|223|1|bare open (scoped) Classical|

Current commit [68bcde29b1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/68bcde29b1b61e862925f55391d179ab574001ed)
Reference commit [d554797db1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/d554797db161743e93778a10b0fe9336dce8527a)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

To me, something like this feels a bit more idiomatic?
```suggestion
theorem not_irrational_rpow :
     a b : , 0 < a  Irrational a  Irrational b   Irrational (a ^ b) := by
  by_cases hc : Irrational (2 ^ 2)
   use (2 ^ 2), 2, by positivity, hc, irrational_sqrt_two
    rw [ rpow_mul, mul_self_sqrt, rpow_two, sq_sqrt] <;> norm_num
   use 2, 2, by positivity, irrational_sqrt_two, irrational_sqrt_two, hc
```

That's somewhat closer to what I initially did (which can be find in zulip - `` instead of ` ` - but also different and I like this better as it seems closer to the description). I simply followed @eric-wieser 's suggestion, so I wonder how you think about.

The idea behind my suggestion is that starting with a `` is use elsewhere in the `Counterexamples` folder; the premise being that you're writing exactly the type that you would write for a regular theorem, but then putting a `not` before it to indicate it doesn't hold.

In that case, you could still golf the proof slightly:
```suggestion
theorem not_irrational_rpow :   a b : , Irrational a  Irrational b  0 < a  Irrational (a ^ b)
    := by
  push_neg
  by_cases hc : Irrational (2 ^ 2)
   use (2 ^ 2), 2, hc, irrational_sqrt_two, by positivity
    rw [ rpow_mul, mul_self_sqrt, rpow_two, sq_sqrt] <;> norm_num
   use 2, 2, irrational_sqrt_two, irrational_sqrt_two, by positivity, hc
```
Thanks! I didn't know about `push_neg` (and `positivity` also..)
I think "required" is the wrong perspective here, including it just makes the counterexample more interesting.
"is imposed" could be a better phrasing

pullRequest.title: counterexample: irrational $a$, $b$ with rational $a^b$
